column4: Hi there. I installed Wubi 8.10 on a Windows Vista, and since then I can't get an internet connection *on windows*. Any idea of why?
i dont think ubuntu caused that,could u give us more info?
I don't think it was Ubuntu, but maybe Wubi
the issue started after installing wubi
well i dont,give us some more info about what's the problem you are having with your network
I'm afraid of uninstalling wubi because then I might end with no internet at all

normally after booting windows a couple of applications connect to their servers: msn messenger, skype etc. Now they just can't connect. And I can't browse, there's an error page asking if I typed the email correctl. f I'm connecte etc.
@ your taskbar,down right corner,does the icons shows that you are connected to your network ?
try unplugging your ethernet and then plug it back in,are you sure that cables are all set up ?
I tried that, and rebooting and shutting everything off, and trying the other day... no luck, but if I reboot into ubuntu I can use the web (like right now)
I tried that, and rebooting and shutting everything off, and trying the other day... no luck, but if I reboot into ubuntu I can use the web (like right now)
did u try restarting ur modem/router?Or trying to connect to it?
i tried restarting, no luck. and i don't know its IP
i dont think that wubi or ubuntu is what caused ur problem,maybe u should try getting some help for windows not ubuntu.
thanks. I agree the issue would be very unlikely and sort of inedit. I'll see what I can do
sorry for not being able to help ya
btw, not my computer. I'll have a hard time trying to fix windows :D
